p: Influenza A viruses (IAVs) are a leading cause of severe respiratory disease and death. IAVs pose a threat, particularly to human health, through the continual emergence of seasonal epidemics and occasional global pandemics ( Krammer et al., 2018, Paules and Subbarao, 2017). The epidemiological “success” of IAVs depends on their ability to efficiently infect and subsequently transmit among host individuals, typically via airborne respiratory droplets ( Killingley and Nguyen-Van-Tam, 2013, Neumann and Kawaoka, 2015). To combat this danger, significant resources have been deployed to establish global networks for detecting, sequencing, and surveilling potentially hazardous IAV strains, both within humans and other species ( Ziegler et al., 2018).
